document_title: Acute appendicitis: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
For acute appendicitis, the patient will need immediate surgery to remove the organ. If left for too long, the risk of rupture will be very high. Accordingly, two commonly applied surgical methods include: (2)
Laparoscopic surgery: The doctor will make a small cut in the abdomen to remove the appendix.; Open surgery: The doctor will make a single incision in the lower right side of the abdomen to remove the appendix.; If the appendix ruptures, at risk of causing serious infection in the abdomen, the surgeon will perform a parallel operation to remove the appendix and clean the abdomen.
